titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation. James R. Whereas we have upon several occasions solemnly declared our royal inclinations and constant resolution of giving free liberty of conscience to all our subjects: in pursuance whereof, we have given our royal assent to a bill passed ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Andrew Crook the assign of Benjamin Tooke printer to the King's most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at Dublin-Castle the 13th day of December 1689."
Protestant ministers not to be dispossessed. Cf. Steele.
In this edition the seventh word of the imprint reads: "assign".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
